listitem.para: RCC Internal/External Oscillator (HSE, HSI, LSE and LSI) configuration structure definition
RCC System, AHB and APB busses clock configuration structure definition
Enable or disable the AHB1 peripheral clock.
Enable or disable the AHB2 peripheral clock.
Enable or disable the Low Speed APB (APB1) peripheral clock.
Enable or disable the High Speed APB (APB2) peripheral clock.
Force or release AHB1 peripheral reset.
Force or release AHB2 peripheral reset.
Force or release APB1 peripheral reset.
Force or release APB2 peripheral reset.
Force or release AHB3 peripheral reset.
Enable or disable the AHB1 peripheral clock during Low Power (Sleep) mode.
Enable or disable the AHB2 peripheral clock during Low Power (Sleep) mode.
Enable or disable the APB1 peripheral clock during Low Power (Sleep) mode.
Enable or disable the APB2 peripheral clock during Low Power (Sleep) mode.
Macros to enable or disable the Internal High Speed oscillator (HSI).
Macro to adjust the Internal High Speed oscillator (HSI) calibration value.
Macros to enable or disable the Internal Low Speed oscillator (LSI).
Macro to configure the External High Speed oscillator (HSE).
Macro to configure the External Low Speed oscillator (LSE).
Macros to enable or disable the the RTC clock.
Macros to configure the RTC clock (RTCCLK).
Macros to force or release the Backup domain reset.
Macros to enable or disable the main PLL.
Macro to configure the main PLL clock source, multiplication and division factors.
Macro to configure the I2S clock source (I2SCLK).
Macros to enable or disable the PLLI2S.
Macro to configure the PLLI2S clock multiplication and division factors .
Macro to get the clock source used as system clock.
Macro to get the oscillator used as PLL clock source.
Enable RCC interrupt (Perform Byte access to RCC_CIR[14:8] bits to enable the selected interrupts).
Disable RCC interrupt (Perform Byte access to RCC_CIR[14:8] bits to disable the selected interrupts).
Clear the RCC's interrupt pending bits (Perform Byte access to RCC_CIR[23:16] bits to clear the selected interrupt pending bits.
Check the RCC's interrupt has occurred or not.
Set RMVF bit to clear the reset flags: RCC_FLAG_PINRST, RCC_FLAG_PORRST, RCC_FLAG_SFTRST, RCC_FLAG_IWDGRST, RCC_FLAG_WWDGRST and RCC_FLAG_LPWRRST.
Check RCC flag is set or not.

section.title: __GPIOA_CLK_ENABLE

para.para: Enable or disable the AHB1 peripheral clock.

section.title: __GPIOA_CLK_SLEEP_DISABLE
section.para: Definition at line 748 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __GPIOA_CLK_SLEEP_ENABLE

para.para: Enable or disable the AHB1 peripheral clock during Low Power (Sleep) mode.

note.title: Note
note.para: Peripheral clock gating in SLEEP mode can be used to further reduce power consumption.
After wakeup from SLEEP mode, the peripheral clock is enabled again.
By default, all peripheral clocks are enabled during SLEEP mode.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_BACKUPRESET_FORCE

para.para: Macros to force or release the Backup domain reset.

note.title: Note
note.para: This function resets the RTC peripheral (including the backup registers) and the RTC clock source selection in RCC_CSR register.
The BKPSRAM is not affected by this reset.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_CLEAR_IT

para.para: Clear the RCC's interrupt pending bits (Perform Byte access to RCC_CIR[23:16] bits to clear the selected interrupt pending bits.

entry.para:
specifies the interrupt pending bit to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
RCC_IT_LSIRDY: LSI ready interrupt.
RCC_IT_LSERDY: LSE ready interrupt.
RCC_IT_HSIRDY: HSI ready interrupt.
RCC_IT_HSERDY: HSE ready interrupt.
RCC_IT_PLLRDY: Main PLL ready interrupt.
RCC_IT_PLLI2SRDY: PLLI2S ready interrupt.
RCC_IT_CSS: Clock Security System interrupt

clock source used as system clock. The returned value can be one of the following:

section.para: Definition at line 1035 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_HSE_CONFIG

para.para: Macro to configure the External High Speed oscillator (HSE).

note.title: Note
note.para: After enabling the HSE (RCC_HSE_ON or RCC_HSE_Bypass), the application software should wait on HSERDY flag to be set indicating that HSE clock is stable and can be used to clock the PLL and/or system clock.
HSE state can not be changed if it is used directly or through the PLL as system clock. In this case, you have to select another source of the system clock then change the HSE state (ex. disable it).
The HSE is stopped by hardware when entering STOP and STANDBY modes.
This function reset the CSSON bit, so if the clock security system(CSS) was previously enabled you have to enable it again after calling this function.

entry.para:
specifies the new state of the HSE. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RCC_HSE_OFF: turn OFF the HSE oscillator, HSERDY flag goes low after 6 HSE oscillator clock cycles.
RCC_HSE_ON: turn ON the HSE oscillator.
RCC_HSE_BYPASS: HSE oscillator bypassed with external clock.

section.para: Definition at line 893 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_HSI_CALIBRATIONVALUE_ADJUST

para.para: Macro to adjust the Internal High Speed oscillator (HSI) calibration value.

note.title: Note
note.para: The calibration is used to compensate for the variations in voltage and temperature that influence the frequency of the internal HSI RC.

entry.para: specifies the calibration trimming value. This parameter must be a number between 0 and 0x1F.

section.para: Definition at line 860 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_HSI_DISABLE
section.para: Definition at line 852 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_HSI_ENABLE

para.para: Macros to enable or disable the Internal High Speed oscillator (HSI).

note.title: Note
note.para: The HSI is stopped by hardware when entering STOP and STANDBY modes. It is used (enabled by hardware) as system clock source after startup from Reset, wakeup from STOP and STANDBY mode, or in case of failure of the HSE used directly or indirectly as system clock (if the Clock Security System CSS is enabled).
HSI can not be stopped if it is used as system clock source. In this case, you have to select another source of the system clock then stop the HSI.

After enabling the HSI, the application software should wait on HSIRDY flag to be set indicating that HSI clock is stable and can be used as system clock source.
This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.
When the HSI is stopped, HSIRDY flag goes low after 6 HSI oscillator clock cycles.

section.para: Definition at line 851 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_I2SCLK

para.para: Macro to configure the I2S clock source (I2SCLK).

note.title: Note
note.para: This function must be called before enabling the I2S APB clock.

entry.para:
specifies the I2S clock source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RCC_I2SCLKSOURCE_PLLI2S: PLLI2S clock used as I2S clock source.
RCC_I2SCLKSOURCE_EXT: External clock mapped on the I2S_CKIN pin used as I2S clock source.

section.para: Definition at line 1005 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_LSE_CONFIG

para.para: Macro to configure the External Low Speed oscillator (LSE).

note.title: Note
note.para: As the LSE is in the Backup domain and write access is denied to this domain after reset, you have to enable write access using HAL_PWR_EnableBkUpAccess() function before to configure the LSE (to be done once after reset).
After enabling the LSE (RCC_LSE_ON or RCC_LSE_BYPASS), the application software should wait on LSERDY flag to be set indicating that LSE clock is stable and can be used to clock the RTC.

entry.para:
specifies the new state of the LSE. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RCC_LSE_OFF: turn OFF the LSE oscillator, LSERDY flag goes low after 6 LSE oscillator clock cycles.
RCC_LSE_ON: turn ON the LSE oscillator.
RCC_LSE_BYPASS: LSE oscillator bypassed with external clock.

section.para: Definition at line 911 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_LSI_DISABLE
section.para: Definition at line 872 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_LSI_ENABLE

para.para: Macros to enable or disable the Internal Low Speed oscillator (LSI).

note.title: Note
note.para: After enabling the LSI, the application software should wait on LSIRDY flag to be set indicating that LSI clock is stable and can be used to clock the IWDG and/or the RTC.
LSI can not be disabled if the IWDG is running.
When the LSI is stopped, LSIRDY flag goes low after 6 LSI oscillator clock cycles.

section.para: Definition at line 871 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_PLL_CONFIG

para.para: Macro to configure the main PLL clock source, multiplication and division factors.

note.title: Note
note.para: This function must be used only when the main PLL is disabled.

entry.para:
specifies the PLL entry clock source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RCC_PLLSOURCE_HSI: HSI oscillator clock selected as PLL clock entry
RCC_PLLSOURCE_HSE: HSE oscillator clock selected as PLL clock entry

note.title: Note
note.para: This clock source (RCC_PLLSource) is common for the main PLL and PLLI2S.

entry.para: specifies the division factor for PLL VCO input clock This parameter must be a number between Min_Data = 2 and Max_Data = 63.

note.title: Note
note.para: You have to set the PLLM parameter correctly to ensure that the VCO input frequency ranges from 1 to 2 MHz. It is recommended to select a frequency of 2 MHz to limit PLL jitter.

entry.para: specifies the multiplication factor for PLL VCO output clock This parameter must be a number between Min_Data = 192 and Max_Data = 432.

note.title: Note
note.para: You have to set the PLLN parameter correctly to ensure that the VCO output frequency is between 192 and 432 MHz.

entry.para: specifies the division factor for main system clock (SYSCLK) This parameter must be a number in the range {2, 4, 6, or 8}.

note.title: Note
note.para: You have to set the PLLP parameter correctly to not exceed 168 MHz on the System clock frequency.

entry.para: specifies the division factor for OTG FS, SDIO and RNG clocks This parameter must be a number between Min_Data = 2 and Max_Data = 15.

note.title: Note
note.para: If the USB OTG FS is used in your application, you have to set the PLLQ parameter correctly to have 48 MHz clock for the USB. However, the SDIO and RNG need a frequency lower than or equal to 48 MHz to work correctly.

section.para: Definition at line 992 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_PLL_DISABLE
section.para: Definition at line 963 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_PLL_ENABLE

para.para: Macros to enable or disable the main PLL.

note.title: Note
note.para: After enabling the main PLL, the application software should wait on PLLRDY flag to be set indicating that PLL clock is stable and can be used as system clock source.
The main PLL can not be disabled if it is used as system clock source
The main PLL is disabled by hardware when entering STOP and STANDBY modes.

section.para: Definition at line 962 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_PLLI2S_CONFIG

para.para: Macro to configure the PLLI2S clock multiplication and division factors .

note.title: Note
note.para: This macro must be used only when the PLLI2S is disabled.
PLLI2S clock source is common with the main PLL (configured in HAL_RCC_ClockConfig() API).

entry.para: specifies the multiplication factor for PLLI2S VCO output clock This parameter must be a number between Min_Data = 192 and Max_Data = 432.

note.title: Note
note.para: You have to set the PLLI2SN parameter correctly to ensure that the VCO output frequency is between Min_Data = 192 and Max_Data = 432 MHz.

entry.para: specifies the division factor for I2S clock This parameter must be a number between Min_Data = 2 and Max_Data = 7.

note.title: Note
note.para: You have to set the PLLI2SR parameter correctly to not exceed 192 MHz on the I2S clock frequency.

section.para: Definition at line 1026 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_PLLI2S_DISABLE
section.para: Definition at line 1011 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_PLLI2S_ENABLE

para.para: Macros to enable or disable the PLLI2S.

note.title: Note
note.para: The PLLI2S is disabled by hardware when entering STOP and STANDBY modes.

section.para: Definition at line 1010 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_RTC_CLKPRESCALER
section.programlisting: (((__RTCCLKSource__) & RCC_BDCR_RTCSEL) == RCC_BDCR_RTCSEL) ? \ MODIFY_REG(RCC->CFGR, RCC_CFGR_RTCPRE, ((__RTCCLKSource__) & 0xFFFFCFF)) : CLEAR_BIT(RCC->CFGR, RCC_CFGR_RTCPRE)

para.para: Macros to configure the RTC clock (RTCCLK).

note.title: Note
note.para: As the RTC clock configuration bits are in the Backup domain and write access is denied to this domain after reset, you have to enable write access using the Power Backup Access macro before to configure the RTC clock source (to be done once after reset).

Once the RTC clock is configured it can't be changed unless the
Backup domain is reset using __HAL_RCC_BackupReset_RELEASE() macro, or by a Power On Reset (POR).

entry.para:
specifies the RTC clock source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RCC_RTCCLKSOURCE_LSE: LSE selected as RTC clock.
RCC_RTCCLKSOURCE_LSI: LSI selected as RTC clock.
RCC_RTCCLKSOURCE_HSE_DIVx: HSE clock divided by x selected as RTC clock, where x:[2,31]

note.title: Note
note.para: If the LSE or LSI is used as RTC clock source, the RTC continues to work in STOP and STANDBY modes, and can be used as wakeup source. However, when the HSE clock is used as RTC clock source, the RTC cannot be used in STOP and STANDBY modes.
The maximum input clock frequency for RTC is 1MHz (when using HSE as RTC clock source).

section.para: Definition at line 940 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

section.title: __HAL_RCC_RTC_ENABLE

para.para: Macros to enable or disable the the RTC clock.

note.title: Note
note.para: These macros must be used only after the RTC clock source was selected.

section.title: __OTGFS_CLK_SLEEP_ENABLE

para.para: Enable or disable the AHB2 peripheral clock during Low Power (Sleep) mode.

note.title: Note
note.para: Peripheral clock gating in SLEEP mode can be used to further reduce power consumption.
After wakeup from SLEEP mode, the peripheral clock is enabled again.
By default, all peripheral clocks are enabled during SLEEP mode.

para.para: Enable or disable the High Speed APB (APB2) peripheral clock.

note.title: Note
note.para: After reset, the peripheral clock (used for registers read/write access) is disabled and the application software has to enable this clock before using it.

note.title: Note
note.para: Peripheral clock gating in SLEEP mode can be used to further reduce power consumption.
After wakeup from SLEEP mode, the peripheral clock is enabled again.
By default, all peripheral clocks are enabled during SLEEP mode.

section.title: RCC_FLAG_MASK

para.para: Check RCC flag is set or not.

entry.para:
specifies the flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RCC_FLAG_HSIRDY: HSI oscillator clock ready.
RCC_FLAG_HSERDY: HSE oscillator clock ready.
RCC_FLAG_PLLRDY: Main PLL clock ready.
RCC_FLAG_PLLI2SRDY: PLLI2S clock ready.
RCC_FLAG_LSERDY: LSE oscillator clock ready.
RCC_FLAG_LSIRDY: LSI oscillator clock ready.
RCC_FLAG_BORRST: POR/PDR or BOR reset.
RCC_FLAG_PINRST: Pin reset.
RCC_FLAG_PORRST: POR/PDR reset.
RCC_FLAG_SFTRST: Software reset.
RCC_FLAG_IWDGRST: Independent Watchdog reset.
RCC_FLAG_WWDGRST: Window Watchdog reset.
RCC_FLAG_LPWRRST: Low Power reset.
new state of FLAG (TRUE or FALSE).

section.para: Definition at line 1122 of file stm32f4xx_hal_rcc.h.

para.computeroutput: void HAL_RCC_MCOConfig (uint32_t RCC_MCOx, uint32_t RCC_MCOSource, uint32_t RCC_MCODiv)
